intro: Euphrasia lapponica, commonly known as the Lapland eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, acidic habitats such as heaths, tundra, and rocky slopes. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia lapponica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
